messages.subject: chiropractor
messages.msgSnippet: I am not sure what you mean by pointing in the right direction, do you mean how does it work, or how do you find a chiro?  My understanding of why it works is
messages.messageBody:
I am not sure what you mean by pointing in the right direction, do you mean
how does it work, or how do you find a chiro? My understanding of why it
works is because when you adjust the neck and head areas (for lack of the
technical term) that allows the ear tubes to drain and then the
infection/inflamation to recede. His ears were coated in yeast, and that
was part of what was causing the inflamation and pain. The antibiotics
would have made that worse. Her other recommendations were to candle his
ears, somthing I can describe later.

To find a good chiro I would ask around and see who you can find. We found
a chiro who specializes in kids and is truly wonderful with them and has a
lot of experience with dealing with fears and tears.

I have to go, but if I didn't answer your question or if you have more let
me know.

Carrie
----- Original Message -----
From: "coyote's corner" <janis@...>
To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, November 15, 2003 2:29 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Neck Strain/Sprain


> Carrie,
> This is the first I've heard of a chirp for infection! Can you point me in
the right direction? Brianna is having big trouble w/ antibiotics.
>
> Thanks,
> janis
> ----- Original Message -----
>
